content: We're planning to have a "birds of a feather" discussion today in Q3 (2:45pm Madrid time) on this topic. I've put together a Google doc that highlights some of the usecases for adding version to aid in the discussion. Feel free to add your own comments. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mpbLwGIhoWMfSH_TI368mgQrQOyMwkxPJZdtyKpDCiA/edit?usp=sharing
Where are people getting the idea that DICOM is versionless?

@Abigail Watson I recognize I'm late to the discussion, but DICOM itself states it is versionless. (Or practically so--they've been at v3 for 20 years.) They do regular updates of the standard, but the updates are in a forward/backward compatible manner. If necessary, "breaking changes" are introduced in new SOP classes (closest equivalent is new resources), but most changes are the introduction of optional elements.
